q: You cannot find peace avoiding life.
h:
“You cannot find peace avoiding life.” —
Virginia Woolf

q: If you do not get the chills when you set your goal you're not setting big enough goals.
h:
“If you do not get the chills when you set your goal you're not setting big enough goals.” —
Bob Proctor

q: Every saint has a past, and every sinner has a future.
h:
“Every saint has a past, and every sinner has a future.” —
Oscar Wilde

q: When you consider things like the stars, our affairs don't seem to matter very much, do they?
h:
“When you consider things like the stars, our affairs don't seem to matter very much, do they?” —
Virginia Woolf

q: If I have seen further than others, it is by standing upon the shoulders of giants.
h:
“If I have seen further than others, it is by standing upon the shoulders of giants.” —
Isaac Newton

q: There can be no deep disappointment where there is not deep love.
h:
“There can be no deep disappointment where there is not deep love.” —
Martin Luther King, Jr.

q: Lost Time is never found again.
h:
“Lost Time is never found again.” —
Benjamin Franklin

q: You may forget with whom you laughed, but you will never forget with whom you wept.
h:
“You may forget with whom you laughed, but you will never forget with whom you wept. ” —
Kahlil Gibran

q: Desire is suffering.
h:
“Desire is suffering.” —
Naval Ravikant

q: I think self-awareness is probably the most important thing towards being a champion.
h:
“I think self-awareness is probably the most important thing towards being a champion. ” —
Billie Jean King

q: The worst part of success is trying to find someone who is happy for you.
h:
“The worst part of success is trying to find someone who is happy for you.” —
Bette Midler

q: Just because you are happy it does not mean that the day is perfect but that you have looked beyond its imperfections.
h:
“Just because you are happy it does not mean that the day is perfect but that you have looked beyond its imperfections.” —
Bob Marley

q: People are doing the best that they can from their own level of consciousness.
h:
“People are doing the best that they can from their own level of consciousness.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: An empty head is not really empty; it is stuffed with rubbish. Hence the difficulty of forcing anything into an empty head.
h:
“An empty head is not really empty; it is stuffed with rubbish. Hence the difficulty of forcing anything into an empty head.” —
Eric Hoffer

q: Get busy living, or get busy dying.
h:
“Get busy living, or get busy dying.” —
Stephen King

q: You can't stay in your corner of the Forest waiting for others to come to you. You have to go to them sometimes.
h:
“You can't stay in your corner of the Forest waiting for others to come to you. You have to go to them sometimes.” —
A.A. Milne

q: He who leaves the game wins it.
h:
“He who leaves the game wins it.” —
Nicolas Chamfort

q: The quieter you become, the more you are able to hear.
h:
“The quieter you become, the more you are able to hear.” —
Rumi

q: True friendship ought never to conceal what it thinks.
h:
“True friendship ought never to conceal what it thinks. ” —
St. Jerome

q: An intelligent person hires people who are more intelligent than he is.
h:
“An intelligent person hires people who are more intelligent than he is.” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: Teachers open the door. You enter by yourself.
h:
“Teachers open the door. You enter by yourself. ” —
Chinese Proverb

q: When you know what you want, and want it bad enough, you will find a way to get it.
h:
“When you know what you want, and want it bad enough, you will find a way to get it.” —
Jim Rohn

q: Great things are not done by impulse, but by a series of small things brought together.
h:
“Great things are not done by impulse, but by a series of small things brought together.” —
Vincent van Gogh

q: Life's too mysterious to take too serious.
h:
“Life's too mysterious to take too serious.” —
Mary Engelbreit

q: There is nothing in the world so irresistibly contagious as laughter and good humor.
h:
“There is nothing in the world so irresistibly contagious as laughter and good humor.” —
Charles Dickens

q: Most people fail in life because they major in minor things.
h:
“Most people fail in life because they major in minor things.” —
Tony Robbins

q: If life is a video game, the graphics are great, but the plot is confusing and the tutorial is way too long.
h:
“If life is a video game, the graphics are great, but the plot is confusing and the tutorial is way too long.” —
Elon Musk

q: Simplicity is a difficult thing to achieve.
h:
“Simplicity is a difficult thing to achieve. ” —
Charlie Chaplin

q: To plant a garden is to believe in tomorrow.
h:
“To plant a garden is to believe in tomorrow. ” —
Audrey Hepburn

q: Storms don't last forever.
h:
“Storms don't last forever.” —
Unknown

q: Elegance does not consist in putting on a new dress.
h:
“Elegance does not consist in putting on a new dress.” —
Coco Chanel

q: You live by what you thrill to, and there's the end of it.
h:
“You live by what you thrill to, and there's the end of it.” —
D. H. Lawrence

q: Question everything. Learn something. Answer nothing.
h:
“Question everything. Learn something. Answer nothing.” —
Euripides

q: Take the attitude of a student. Never be too big to ask questions. Never know too much to learn something new.
h:
“Take the attitude of a student. Never be too big to ask questions. Never know too much to learn something new.” —
Og Mandino
